title: Retrieve or change the integration user password
content:
Service Management uses a system-defined user account named bo-integration@dummy.com for integration purposes such as data synchronization between Suite Administration and tenants. The initial password for this integration user account is set at the time of suite installation.

You may need to check or change the integration user account password from time to time. Especially if you forget the password or your organization's security policy requires regular updates. This topic shows you how to do both.

Retrieve integration user password

Complete the following steps to find the current password for the integration user account.
  1. Run the following command on a control plane or a bastion node to find the pod running the itom-bo-login-deployment service. The pod name resembles itom-bo-login-deployment-xxxxxxxx, where xxxxxxxx is a unique identifier. 
    kubectl get pods -n <suite namespace> | grep itom-bo-login-deployment

  2. Run the following command to retrieve the integration user password. Use the pod name identified in the earlier step.

    kubectl exec -it <pod name> -n <suite namespace> -c itom-bo-login -- get_secret bo_integration_password_secret_key
    For example: 
    kubectl exec -it itom-bo-login-deployment-xxxxxxxx -n <suite namespace> -c itom-bo-login -- get_secret bo_integration_password_secret_key

Change integration user password in IdM portal

Complete the following steps to set a new password for the integration user account.

Prerequisites

  • Make sure you know the suite-admin user password. You will need it to login to the IdM Admin Portal.
  • Make sure the following password requirements are met:
    • Length must be between 10 to 16 characters.
    • Must contain at least one uppercase letter.
    • Must contain at least one lowercase letter.
    • Must contain at least one numeric character.
    • Must contain at least one special character from the following: , : / . _ ? & % = + - [ ] ( ).
    • You must restart the Suite after changing the integration user password.
Changing the password affects all integrations that use this account. After you update the integration user’s password, be sure to change it in every integration where the account is used.

Enter the new password

  1. Log in to IdM admin portal as suite-admin: https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin.

  2. Select the SYSBO organization.
  3. On the left navigation pane, select Users. 
  4. Select bo-integration@dummy.com.
  5. Click Reset password.
  6. Enter the save the new password .

Restart the suite

  1. From the control plane node (on embedded K8s) or bastion node (on managed K8s) go to the scripts directory. The paths are as follows:
    • Control plane: $CDF_HOME/scripts
    • Bastion node: OMT_External_K8s_2x.x-xxx/scripts

  2. Run the following commands in sequence to restart the suite:

    ./cdfctl.sh runlevel set -l DOWN -n <suite namespace>
./cdfctl.sh runlevel set -l UP -n <suite namespace>
